newsitem.title: UK: BoE/committee to be accountable for inflation - FT.
newsitem.headline: BoE/committee to be accountable for inflation - FT.

text.p: A tough system of holding the Bank of England and the new monetary committee accountable if they fail to meet the inflation target will be announced on Thursday, the Financial Times said.

Each time inflation is one percentage point above or below a new target rate of inflation, Eddie George, the Bank of England Governor, will have to write an open letter to Chancellor of the Exchequer Gordon Brown explaining the miss.
George will also have to say what actions the Bank is taking to correct it and predict when inflation will be back on track, the paper said.

The new monetary policy arrangements will be disclosed in Brown's annual Mansion House speech (1930 GMT), when he will symbolically reject traditional City of London ceremony by wearing a lounge suit rather than white tie and tails.
Brown was also expected to announce that his first inflation target -- subject to revisions in future budgets -- will be an annual 2.5 percent.
